intro: Aquilegia winterbottomiana, commonly known as the winterbottom's columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with palmate leaves that are deeply lobed. Its flowers come in shades of blue, purple, and white, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
